title: How to Make Vegan Red Velvet Cake

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 350ºF/180ºC.
steps.description: Grease two 9-inch baking pans in readiness for adding the batter to shortly. Vegetable oil or vegetable margarine can be used to grease the sides of the pan. If preferred, use parchment paper on the base but make sure it fits snugly, to avoid creases in the baked cake.

steps.headline: Add the dry ingredients to a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt to the bowl. Whisk all of the dry ingredients in the large bowl. Blend the ingredients together well.

steps.headline: Add the almond milk, vegetable oil, red food coloring and 2 tablespoons of vanilla extract to the dry mixture.
steps.description: Add white vinegar to the mixture. Do this as you're mixing the liquid ingredients. Continue stirring the liquid ingredients into the dry until all ingredients are well blended. Your batter is now ready for transferring to the cake pans.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into both of the greased 9-inch baking pans.
Place the pans into the oven.
steps.description: Center the pans but do not let them touch; allow for some airflow between both pans. Bake the cakes for 25-30 minutes. Test with a toothpick; if it comes out clean, they're baked but if cake mix still sticks to them, they need a little longer. If they are still not fully baked, put your cakes back in the oven for a few more minutes at a time, making sure to consistently check them to avoid over-baking.

steps.headline: Place both pans on a wire rack to cool.
steps.description: Let the cakes stay in the pans cooling for roughly 10 minutes. Don't leave too long in the pan, to avoid making the bases too moist.

steps.headline: Remove both cakes from the pans after 10 minutes have passed.
steps.description: Then set the cakes back onto the wire rack to cool further. Be careful when removing the cakes from the pan; they may break apart easily (this is why allowing them to cool in the pan for a little bit first helps). It is a good idea to line the wire rack with a clean tea towel or similar cloth to avoid marking the base of the cakes with wire lines.

steps.headline: Make the frosting.
steps.description: To do this, pour the confectioner's sugar into a large mixing bowl. Then, add 16 oz of vegan cream cheese, like Tofutti Better Than Cream Cheese, to the large bowl with the confectioners sugar. It's easier, too, if you let the cream cheese soften for a few minutes before starting the frosting process.

steps.headline: Add the vegan margarine to the bowl.
steps.description: Also add 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract to the large bowl.

steps.headline: Use a mixer to blend the ingredients.
steps.description: Keep blending until it has a smooth consistency but make sure you don't blend the frosting too much or it may turn gritty. Blending by hand is fine too, using a spoon or a whisk.

steps.headline: Place 1 of the baked cake halves on a platter.
steps.description: This platter should be the one you intend to serve the cake on.

steps.headline: Spread 3/4 cup of the frosting on top of the cake that you just placed onto the platter.
steps.description: This forms the middle filling of your vegan red velvet cake.

steps.headline: Place the unfrosted cake half onto the frosting you have just spread.
steps.description: This becomes the top of your red velvet cake.

steps.headline: Spread the remaining frosting right around the sides of the cake.
steps.description: Spread the frosting generously until the red velvet cake is fully covered.

steps.headline: Refrigerate your cake immediately after it is finished.
steps.description: Wait at least 45 minutes before cutting and serving, to firm the cake fully. This will give your cake a lesser chance of falling apart. It also means you can store it refrigerated ahead of time, to allow you to get on with making other dishes for your guests.

text: Making the Cake Preheat oven to 350ºF/180ºC. Grease two 9-inch baking pans in readiness for adding the batter to shortly. Vegetable oil or vegetable margarine can be used to grease the sides of the pan. If preferred, use parchment paper on the base but make sure it fits snugly, to avoid creases in the baked cake. Add the dry ingredients to a large mixing bowl. Add the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt to the bowl. Whisk all of the dry ingredients in the large bowl. Blend the ingredients together well. Add the almond milk, vegetable oil, red food coloring and 2 tablespoons of vanilla extract to the dry mixture. Add white vinegar to the mixture. Do this as you're mixing the liquid ingredients. Continue stirring the liquid ingredients into the dry until all ingredients are well blended. Your batter is now ready for transferring to the cake pans. Pour the batter into both of the greased 9-inch baking pans.  Place the pans into the oven. Center the pans but do not let them touch; allow for some airflow between both pans. Bake the cakes for 25-30 minutes. Test with a toothpick; if it comes out clean, they're baked but if cake mix still sticks to them, they need a little longer. If they are still not fully baked, put your cakes back in the oven for a few more minutes at a time, making sure to consistently check them to avoid over-baking. Place both pans on a wire rack to cool. Let the cakes stay in the pans cooling for roughly 10 minutes. Don't leave too long in the pan, to avoid making the bases too moist. Remove both cakes from the pans after 10 minutes have passed. Then set the cakes back onto the wire rack to cool further. Be careful when removing the cakes from the pan; they may break apart easily (this is why allowing them to cool in the pan for a little bit first helps). It is a good idea to line the wire rack with a clean tea towel or similar cloth to avoid marking the base of the cakes with wire lines. Frosting the Cake Make the frosting. To do this, pour the confectioner's sugar into a large mixing bowl. Then, add 16 oz of vegan cream cheese, like Tofutti Better Than Cream Cheese, to the large bowl with the confectioners sugar. It's easier, too, if you let the cream cheese soften for a few minutes before starting the frosting process. Add the vegan margarine to the bowl. Also add 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract to the large bowl. Use a mixer to blend the ingredients. Keep blending until it has a smooth consistency but make sure you don't blend the frosting too much or it may turn gritty. Blending by hand is fine too, using a spoon or a whisk. Place 1 of the baked cake halves on a platter. This platter should be the one you intend to serve the cake on. Spread 3/4 cup of the frosting on top of the cake that you just placed onto the platter. This forms the middle filling of your vegan red velvet cake. Place the unfrosted cake half onto the frosting you have just spread. This becomes the top of your red velvet cake. Spread the remaining frosting right around the sides of the cake. Spread the frosting generously until the red velvet cake is fully covered. Refrigerate your cake immediately after it is finished. Wait at least 45 minutes before cutting and serving, to firm the cake fully. This will give your cake a lesser chance of falling apart. It also means you can store it refrigerated ahead of time, to allow you to get on with making other dishes for your guests.
